bug.author: ShreyaKhurana
bug.summary: CNN evaluation on translation task gives unexpected keys error
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>‚ùì Questions and Help</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h4>What is your question?</denchmark-h>
I followed the instructions to train the fconv_wmt_en_de model and then was trying to evaluate the checkpoint. But I get the following error (all layers with linearized_weight are not there in state_dict): <denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "/home/skhurana/fairseq/venv/bin/fairseq-generate", line 11, in <module> load_entry_point('fairseq', 'console_scripts', 'fairseq-generate')() File "/home/skhurana/fairseq/fairseq/fairseq_cli/generate.py", line 234, in cli_main main(args) File "/home/skhurana/fairseq/fairseq/fairseq_cli/generate.py", line 35, in main return _main(args, sys.stdout) File "/home/skhurana/fairseq/fairseq/fairseq_cli/generate.py", line 71, in _main task=task, File "/home/skhurana/fairseq/fairseq/fairseq/checkpoint_utils.py", line 186, in load_model_ensemble ensemble, args, _task = load_model_ensemble_and_task(filenames, arg_overrides, task) File "/home/skhurana/fairseq/fairseq/fairseq/checkpoint_utils.py", line 205, in load_model_ensemble_and_task model.load_state_dict(state["model"], strict=True, args=args) File "/home/skhurana/fairseq/fairseq/fairseq/models/fairseq_model.py", line 93, in load_state_dict return super().load_state_dict(new_state_dict, strict) File "/home/skhurana/fairseq/venv/lib64/python3.6/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 830, in load_state_dict self.__class__.__name__, "\n\t".join(error_msgs))) RuntimeError: Error(s) in loading state_dict for FConvModel: Unexpected key(s) in state_dict: "decoder.convolutions.0._linearized_weight", "decoder.convolutions.1._linearized_weight", "decoder.convolutions.2._linearized_weight", "decoder.convolutions.3._linearized_weight", "decoder.convolutions.4._linearized_weight", "decoder.convolutions.5._linearized_weight", "decoder.convolutions.6._linearized_weight", "decoder.convolutions.7._linearized_weight", "decoder.convolutions.8._linearized_weight", "decoder.convolutions.9._linearized_weight", "decoder.convolutions.10._linearized_weight", "decoder.convolutions.11._linearized_weight", "decoder.convolutions.12._linearized_weight", "decoder.convolutions.13._linearized_weight", "decoder.convolutions.14._linearized_weight". </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h4>Code</denchmark-h>
I train the model on a single V100 GPU using this command <denchmark-code>fairseq-train \ data-bin/conv-large \ --arch fconv_wmt_en_de \ --lr 0.25 --clip-norm 0.1 --dropout 0.2 --max-tokens 4096 \ --criterion label_smoothed_cross_entropy --label-smoothing 0.1 \ --lr-scheduler fixed --force-anneal 50 \ --save-interval 1 --max-epoch 10 \ --save-dir checkpoints/conv-large \ --eval-bleu --eval-bleu-args '{"beam": 5, "max_len_a": 1.2, "max_len_b": 10}' --eval-bleu-detok space --eval-bleu-remove-bpe --eval-bleu-print-samples \ --best-checkpoint-metric bleu --maximize-best-checkpoint-metric </denchmark-code>
and my evaluation command (which I run on CPU) is: <denchmark-code>fairseq-generate data-bin/conv-large \ --path checkpoints/conv-large/checkpoint_best.pt \ --beam 5 --remove-bpe --cpu </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h4>What have you tried?</denchmark-h>
Tried using different dataset and but I get the same error. Also checked to see if it's an architecture-specific error - turns out transformer evaluation is okay, just the CNN throws this error. <denchmark-h:h4>What's your environment?</denchmark-h>
fairseq Version (e.g., 1.0 or master): master PyTorch Version (e.g., 1.0): 1.4.0+cpu on inference, 1.4.0 while training OS (e.g., Linux): Linux How you installed fairseq (pip, source): source Build command you used (if compiling from source): pip install --editable . Python version: 3.6.8

comments.comment: This is a bug due to the interaction between --eval-bleu and fconv. I'll submit a fix.
